text: Hey! Awesome dude, nice to meet you.

It was fairly intense but yeah we looked back on the very first game designs too. Ah 3rd year always tends to build up a bit of pressure. Do you have any portfolio put up somewhere to get a sense of your work?

What was his/her name? It's true, we had a team of facial artists there, who were mainly tasked to do facial shapes and some tech fixes (inside of the mouth, teeth position). I was actually part of the team from the beginning because it's a great way to ease your way into the pipeline and the whole studio environment.
I did a bunch of shapes for different background characters from Maleficent. I helped a bit on Cats and then the whole Sonic wave came so after modelling I did all the shapes for him.

In the beginning, I thought of it as being something easier than hardcore sculpting characters from a sphere but I've grown to think the opposite almost. It's way more subtle and you really need to know and get a sense of the bones, muscle, fat, and skin to make a believable shape.
Ah nevermind I just googled you. Your reel is great man, is likely among the best student reels I've seen.
And you presented everything in a super professional way with all the right components that'd get you a job in VFX I think!
